00010 #if !defined(GEOGRAPHICLIB_MAGNETICCIRCLE_HPP)
00011 #define GEOGRAPHICLIB_MAGNETICCIRCLE_HPP "$Id: de919c519a73ddbaa944ebdd377e514d0e7899cb $"
00012 
00013 #include <string>
00014 #include <vector>
00015 #include <GeographicLib/Constants.hpp>
00016 #include <GeographicLib/CircularEngine.hpp>
00017 
00018 namespace GeographicLib {
00019 
00020   /**
00021    * \brief Geomagnetic field on a circle of latitude
00022    *
00023    * Evaluate the earth's magnetic field on a circle of constant height and
00024    * latitude.  This uses a CircleEngine to pre-evaluate the inner sum of the
00025    * spherical harmonic sum, allowing the values of the field at different
00026    * latitude to be evaluated rapidly.
00027    *
00028    * Use MagneticModel::Circle to create a MagneticCircle object.  (The
00029    * constructor for this class is private.)
00030    **********************************************************************/
00031 
00032   class GEOGRAPHIC_EXPORT MagneticCircle {
00033   private:
00034     typedef Math::real real;
00035 
00036     real _a, _cphi, _sphi, _t, _dt0;
00037     bool _interpolate;
00038     CircularEngine _circ0, _circ1;
00039 
00040     MagneticCircle(real a, real cphi, real sphi, real t, real dt0,
00041                    bool interpolate,
00042                    const CircularEngine& circ0, const CircularEngine& circ1)
00043       : _a(a)
00044       , _cphi(cphi)
00045       , _sphi(sphi)
00046       , _t(t)
00047       , _dt0(dt0)
00048       , _interpolate(interpolate)
00049       , _circ0(circ0)
00050       , _circ1(circ1)
00051     {}
00052 
00053     void Field(real lon, bool diffp,
00054                real& Bx, real& By, real& Bz,
00055                real& Bxt, real& Byt, real& Bzt) const;
00056 
00057     friend class MagneticModel; // MagneticModel calls the private constructor
00058 
00059   public:
00060 
00061     /**
00062      * Evaluate the components of the geomagnetic field at a particular
00063      * longitude.
00064      *
00065      * @param[in] lon longitude of the point (degrees).
00066      * @param[out] Bx the easterly component of the magnetic field (nanotesla).
00067      * @param[out] By the northerly component of the magnetic field (nanotesla).
00068      * @param[out] Bz the vertical (up) component of the magnetic field
00069      *   (nanotesla).
00070      **********************************************************************/
00071     void operator()(real lon, real& Bx, real& By, real& Bz) const {
00072       real dummy;
00073       Field(lon, false, Bx, By, Bz, dummy, dummy, dummy);
00074     }
00075 
00076     /**
00077      * Evaluate the components of the geomagnetic field and their time
00078      * derivatives at a particular longitude.
00079      *
00080      * @param[in] lon longitude of the point (degrees).
00081      * @param[out] Bx the easterly component of the magnetic field (nanotesla).
00082      * @param[out] By the northerly component of the magnetic field (nanotesla).
00083      * @param[out] Bz the vertical (up) component of the magnetic field
00084      *   (nanotesla).
00085      * @param[out] Bxt the rate of change of \e Bx (nT/yr).
00086      * @param[out] Byt the rate of change of \e By (nT/yr).
00087      * @param[out] Bzt the rate of change of \e Bz (nT/yr).
00088      **********************************************************************/
00089     void operator()(real lon, real& Bx, real& By, real& Bz,
00090                     real& Bxt, real& Byt, real& Bzt) const {
00091       Field(lon, true, Bx, By, Bz, Bxt, Byt, Bzt);
00092     }
00093   };
00094 
00095 } // namespace GeographicLib
00096 
00097 #endif  // GEOGRAPHICLIB_MAGNETICCIRCLE_HPP
